title: What kind of education did rural children receive in the Middle Ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: What kind of education did rural children receive in the Middle Ages? Primarily parental instruction. This was for social discipline, necessary farm labor, sex, and local geography. Simply said, there were no schools for commoners and no time for them even if they had existed. Religious instruction would have come from the local church, but even those priests assigned to villages were generally ill-educated on anything but scripture, enforcing public morality, sacramental instructions, and how to send a portion of their income to the local bishop. Extraordinary children might be singled out for clerical instruction and sent to a monastery or a minster to learn to read and write and do his numbers, as well as other churchly duties. He could be employed by a local lord, but would probably remain in the church, anticipating further promotion in the institution.
